p: Some proteins, exhibiting an increased relative abundance in the model perfusate, have been already reported to be associated with cancer metastasis, such as Rpl21 [ 16], Emilin1 [ 17], Eif3s2 [ 18, 19], Echs1 [ 20] and CtsD [ 21- 24]. The relative abundance of CtsD was 5.6-fold elevated in the perfusates from the livers metastasized by Walker-256 tumor cells. CtsD is a lysosomal enzyme, which was reported to be secreted by the breast cancer cells [ 21, 22]. It was also involved in the metastasis of breast cancer and was an independent prognostic biomarker for the cancer [ 23, 24].
